00009     PGinfo.pl
00010 
00011 
00012 Provides macros for determining the values of the current context in which the problem
00013 is being written.

00024 =head3  listVariables
00025 
00026 Usage:  listVariables();
00027 
00028 Prints all variables submitted in the problem form and all variables in the
00029 the Problem environment and all of the flag variables in Context().
00030 This is used for debugging and to determine the current
00031 context for the problem.
00032 
00033 =cut
00034 
00035 
00036 sub listVariables {
00037     TEXT($HR,"Form variables",$BR );
00038     listFormVariables();
00039     TEXT($HR,"Environment variables",$BR );
00040     listEnvironmentVariables();
00041     TEXT($HR,"Context flags",$BR );
00042     listContextFlags();
00043 }
00044 
00045 =head4 listFormVariables()
00046 
00047     Called by listVariables to print out the input form variables.
00048 
00049 =cut
00050 
00051 sub listFormVariables {
00052     # Lists all of the variables filled out on the input form
00053     # Useful for debugging
00054     TEXT(pretty_print($inputs_ref));
00055 
00056 }
00057 
00058 =head4 listEnvironmentVariables()
00059 
00060     Called by listVariables to print out the environment variables (in %envir).
00061 
00062 =cut
00063 
00064 
00065 sub listEnvironmentVariables {
00066     # list the environment variables
00067     TEXT(pretty_print(\%envir));
00068 }
00069 
00070 =head4 listContextFlags()
00071 
00072     Called by listVariables to print out context flags for Math Objects.
00073 
00074 =cut
00075 
00076 sub listContextFlags {
00077     my $context = $$Value::context->{flags};
00078     TEXT(pretty_print($context));
00079 }
00080 
00081 =head3 listContext()
00082 
00083     Usage:  listContext(Context())
00084 
00085     Prints out the contents of the current context hash -- includes flags and much more
00086 
00087 =cut
00088 
00089 sub listContext {  # include
00090     my $context = shift;
00091     return TEXT("$PAR Error in listContext:  usage:  listContext(Context()); # must specify a context to list $BR") unless defined $context;
00092     foreach $key (keys %$context) {
00093         next if $key =~/^_/; # skip if it begins with
00094         TEXT($HR, $key, $BR);
00095         TEXT( pretty_print($context->{$key}) );
00096     }
00097 }
00098 
00099 =head3 pp()
00100 
00101     Usage:  pp(Hash );
00102             pp(Object);
00103             
00104 
00105     Prints out the contents of Hash or the instance variables of Object
00106 
00107 =cut
00108 
00109 sub pp {
00110     my $hash = shift;
00111     "printing |". ref($hash)."|$BR". pretty_print($hash);
00112 }
